definition[0]: the past tense and past participle of pay
definition[1]: paid work is work which you receive money for
example[0]: It will become increasingly difficult for those over retirement age to obtain any paid work with which to supplement their pension.
definition[2]: a paid worker receives money for the work which he or she does
example[1]: 75 percent of all paid employees work in firms with less than 100 workers.
definition[3]: if a tax, bill etc is paid, a payment has been made for the money that was owed
example[2]: Unless the bottles are stamped ‘duty paid’, the wine cannot be sold.
